SEARCH
Package gov.cdc.izgw.v2tofhir.utils

Class TestData

java.lang.Object
gov.cdc.izgw.v2tofhir.utils.TestData
public class TestData extends Object
TestData supports reading of HL7 messages or segments from text files in internal resources or external files, where each message or segment can have one or more assertions about the FHIR resource created from the content. Each TestData object is data for a test case, along with the associated assertions that must be true for the test to pass. Files can contain multiple messages or segments, separated by blank lines. Comments can be included in the file, starting with // or #. Each message or segment can have one or more assertions, starting with @. Assertions are written as FHIRPath expressions against the V2 output converted to FHIR, and can include comments after //. This class is a utility class in the main code to support testing and reuse by other projects depending on V2toFHIR, and does not depend on any test framework.
Author:
Audacious Inquiry

      isMessageFile - True if the file contains full messages, false if it contains segments.

    • evaluateAgainst

      public void evaluateAgainst(org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.api.IBase b)
      Evaluate all assertions against a FHIR resource or datatype NOTE: This fails when the first assertion fails. Use this version in production testing.
      Parameters:
      b - The resource or datatype to test against
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if any evaluation fails.

    • evaluateAllAgainst

      public void evaluateAllAgainst(org.hl7.fhir.instance.model.api.IBase b)
      Evaluate all assertions against a FHIR resource or datatype This fails when any assertion fails, and returns the cause of the first failure. The message reports the 1-based index of the failing assertions. Use this version in development testing.
      Parameters:
      b - The resource or datatype to test against
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if any evaluation fails.

    • getAdjustedFhirPath

      public String getAdjustedFhirPath(int position)
      Rewrites FhirPath assertions to exact expression to evaluation from shortened forms. Assertions in test files can be written using simplified FhirPath expressions when the first component represents either the Bundle or a Resource in the bundle. Thus: @MessageHeader is the same as @%context.entry.resource.ofType(MessageHeader) saving about 30 unnecessary characters.
      Parameters:
      position - The assertion to adjust
      Returns:
      The adjusted FHIRPath

    • getComment

      public String getComment(int position)
      Get the comment for an assertion.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the assertion
      Returns:
      The comment associated with the assertion

    • getExpression

      public ca.uhn.fhir.fhirpath.IFhirPath.IParsedExpression getExpression(int position) throws Exception
      Compile and store the expression associated with testData, or return any existing compiled expression.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the assertion in test data
      Returns:
      An expression that can be evaluated.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an exception occurs during the parse.

    • getFhirPath

      public String getFhirPath(int position)
      Get the FHIRPath expression for an assertion.
      Parameters:
      position - The position of the assertion
      Returns:
      The FHIRPath associated with the assertion

    • getName

      public String getName(int position)
      Get the name for the assertion at the given position Assertions are named based on the current segment name and id (e.g., ERR|1, MSH) and have the 1-based assertion following it. Thus OBX|23@3 is the 3rd assertion after ERR|23.
      Parameters:
      position - The position
      Returns:
      The name of the assertion

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Determine if the TestData object is empty.
      Returns:
      true if this object has no data or assertions.
